question: The presence of the Philadelphia chromosome is associated worse with a prognosis in patients with which of the following diseases?
exp: The presence of the Philadelphia chromosome is associated worse with a prognosis in patients with Acute lymphoblastic leukemia

question: Acid phosphastase cytochemical staining is used in the diagnosis of which of the following hematological neoplasms?
exp: Cytochemically demonstrable acid phosphatase has main diagnostic use is in the diagnosis of T-cell ALL and hairy cell leukaemia. In T cells, acid phosphatase is an early differentiation feature. Almost all acute and chronic T-lineage leukaemias show strong activity. In T-lineage ALL, the activity is usually highly localised (polar).

question: Which of the following is not expressed in majority of cases of pediatric B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia?
exp: CD19 is a pan B-cell marker. CALLA (common acute lymphoblastic leukemia antigen) is CD 10. CD45 is known as leukocyte common antigen (LCA). Terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TdT), a specialized DNA polymerase that is expressed only in pre-B and pre-T lymphoblasts, is positive in more than 95% of cases. CD7 is commonly expressed in T-cell ALL.
